source.title: Next.js Quickstart (App Router)
source.description: Next.js App Router quickstart covering @clerk/nextjs installation, clerkMiddleware setup, ClerkProvider configuration, prebuilt authentication components including SignInButton, SignUpButton, SignedIn, SignedOut, and UserButton for user management.

source.title: User management: Users
source.description: User object structure with identifiers and metadata, managing users via Dashboard or programmatically, frontend components (UserButton, UserProfile) and hooks, backend SDK methods including createUser() and deleteUser().

source.title: Session management: Session tokens
source.description: Session token JWT structure and default claims (azp, exp, fva, iat, iss, sid, sub), organisation claims with feature-permission bitmask encoding, actor claims for impersonation, 4KB cookie size limits, and validation.

source.title: Customizing Clerk: Appearance prop
source.description: Customising Clerk component appearance using the appearance prop with prebuilt themes, layout options, CSS variables, element targeting via global CSS, Tailwind classes, CSS modules, and inline style objects.

source.title: How Clerk works
source.description: Clerk architecture covering Frontend API (FAPI), Backend API (BAPI), abstraction levels (prebuilt components, Elements, custom flows), hybrid authentication model with client and session tokens, token refresh mechanism, and handshake flow.

source.title: Component Reference
source.description: Component reference covering authentication (SignIn, SignUp), user (UserButton, UserAvatar), organisation (OrganizationSwitcher), billing (PricingTable), control components (SignedIn, SignedOut, Protect, ClerkLoaded), unstyled buttons, and appearance customisation.

source.title: SDK Reference: Clerk Next.js SDK
source.description: Clerk Next.js SDK overview: clerkMiddleware integration, client-side React hooks for authentication, organizations, and billing, server-side helpers for App and Pages routers, clerkClient backend API, and Auth object structure.

source.title: Authentication flows: Sign-up and sign-in options
source.description: Authentication configuration options including email verification codes/links, phone/SMS with country allowlists, usernames, passwords, passkeys with domain restrictions, SSO connections, Web3 wallets, multi-factor authentication strategies, and user access restrictions.

source.title: Build your own sign-in-or-up page for your Next.js app with Clerk
source.description: Building unified sign-in-or-up pages using SignIn component with Next.js catch-all routes, configuring clerkMiddleware and createRouteMatcher for public routes, setting redirect URL environment variables.

source.title: Build your own sign-up page for your Next.js app with Clerk
source.description: Custom sign-up page setup in Next.js using the SignUp component with catch-all routing, clerkMiddleware route protection with createRouteMatcher, and environment variables for sign-up and redirect URLs.

source.title: Authentication flows: Customize your redirect URLs
source.description: Redirect URL customisation via environment variables (CLERK_SIGN_IN_URL, CLERK_SIGN_UP_URL, FORCE_REDIRECT_URL, FALLBACK_REDIRECT_URL) and component props (fallbackRedirectUrl, forceRedirectUrl, signInFallbackRedirectUrl) for controlling post-authentication navigation.

source.title: Read session and user data in your Next.js app with Clerk
source.description: Server-side helpers: auth(), currentUser() for App Router; getAuth(), clerkClient(), buildClerkProps() for Pages Router. Client-side useAuth() and useUser() hooks for session state, user data, and route protection.
